Column Comment.0: BUSINESS ASSOCIATE: Unique identifier for a business associate, such as aperson, company, regulatory agency, government or consortium.
Column Comment.1: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.2: ADDRESS OBSERVATION NUMBER: A number used to uniquely identifying anaddress for a Business Associate.
Column Comment.3: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.4: ADDRESSEE TEXT: the text of the addressee as it is to appear on an envelope ordocument.
Column Comment.5: ADDRESS TYPE: The type of business associate address. For example shipping,billing, sales...
Column Comment.6: CITY AREA IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the area that is the CITY. Note that ifyou choose, you could use only this FK and derive the COUNTRY andSTATE/PROVINCE (or other subdivision). Alternatively, you may choose to populateall three FK explicitly.
Column Comment.7: CITY AREA TYPE: The second component of the AREA FK for the city. If you areusing natural keys, this is probably going to be CITY.
Column Comment.8: COUNTRY AREA IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the area that is the COUNTRY.Note that if you choose, you could use only the CITY FK and derive the COUNTRYand STATE/PROVINCE (or other subdivision). Alternatively, you may choose topopulate all three FK explicitly. For example Austria, Canada, United Kingdom, USA,Venezula.
Column Comment.9: COUNTRY AREA TYPE: The second component of the AREA FK for the city. If youare using natural keys, this is probably going to be COUNTRY.
Column Comment.10: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.11: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.12: ADDRESS LINE 1: Description or text of the first line of the address for a businessassociate.
Column Comment.13: OFFICE TYPE: the type of office, such as branch, lab facility, etc.
Column Comment.14: POSTAL ZIP CODE: Code number assigned by the postal service identifying a maildelivery zone.
Column Comment.15: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.16: PREFERRED IND: A Y/N flag indicating this contact information is primary orpreferred for the contact information type.
Column Comment.17: PROVINCE STATE AREA IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the area that is theCOUNTRY. Note that if you choose, you could use only the CITY FK and derive theCOUNTRY and STATE/PROVINCE (or other subdivision). Alternatively, you maychoose to populate all three FK explicitly. For example states, provinces or otherpolitical subdivisions of countries.
Column Comment.18: PROVICE STATE AREA TYPE: The second component of the AREA FK for thesubordinate area, such as province, state, emirate, parish etc.
Column Comment.19: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.20: ADDRESS LINE 2: Description or text of second line of address for a businessassociate.
Column Comment.21: SERVICE PERIOD OR HOURS OF OPERATION: the time period each day whenthe business associate is open for business. Should be assumed to be the time in thelocal time zone.
Column Comment.22: SERVICE QUALITY: A code indicating the quality of service received from thisBUSINESS ASSOCIATE, either at a specified address, or for a specific service.
Column Comment.23: ADDRESS LINE 3: Description or text of third line of address for a businessassociate.
Column Comment.24: WITHHOLDING TAX IND: Indicates whether withholding tax is applicable to thisoffice or company, in the event payments are to be made.
Column Comment.25: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.26: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.27: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.28: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.29: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.30: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.31: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
